channel.title: Documentation – Working with Smart Markers
channel.description: Recent content in Working with Smart Markers on Documentation

item.title: Net: Adding Anonymous or Custom Object into SmartMarkers
item.description:
Aspose.Cells for .NET : Adding Anonymous or Custom Object into SmartMarkers

This explains how to import anonymous or custom objects into SmartMarkers.

Sometimes, you need to include custom objects as a data source to the SmartMarkers. Aspose.Cells makes it possible to use custom objects as the data source.

Please see the following sample code which shows how to add custom objects as a data source for SmartMarkers.

item.title: Net: Getting Notifications while Merging Data with Smart Markers
item.description:
Aspose.Cells for .NET : Getting Notifications while Merging Data with Smart Markers

Aspose.Cells APIs provide the WorkbookDesigner class to work with Smart Markers where the formatting & formulas are placed in the designer spreadsheets and then processed with WorkbookDesignerclass to fill up the data according to specified Smart Markers. Sometimes, it may be required to get the notifications about the cell reference or the particular Smart Marker being processed. This can be achieved using the WorkbookDesigner.CallBack property and ISmartMarkerCallBack interface exposed with the release of Aspose.Cells for .NET 8.6.2.

The following piece of code demonstrates the usage of ISmartMarkerCallBackinterface to define a new class that handles the call back for WorkbookDesigner.Process method.

Rest of the process includes loading designer spreadsheet containing the Smart Markers with WorkbookDesignerand process it by setting the data source. In order to keep the example simple, we have used a predefined designer spreadsheet containing only two Smart Markers as shown in the below snapshot where the data source is being created dynamically to merge the data according to the specified Smart Markers.
